702661f-a.title: Brooklyn: 24th Street - 3rd Avenue
702661f-a.text:
24th Street, s.5., e. fr. Ihird Avenue, Brooklyn.
Neg. no. A-1323
P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 21, 190

702662f-b.title: Brooklyn: 24th Street - 3rd Avenue
702662f-b.text:
24th Street, east from Third Avenue. The buildings on
both corners were torn down for the widening of Third Avenue
which later became a link in the Belt Parkway system of
highways. The steeple is that of the Church of Our Lady of
Cremstochowa.
V0227 October 17, 1940
P. L. Sperr  Vie2 M 62RS M7, N1Y7

24th Street, east from Third Avenue. The buildings on

702281f-c.title: Brooklyn: 3rd Avenue - 24th Street
702281f-c.text:
3rd Avenue, south from 24th to 26th Streets. The clearance
on the eaat side of the avenue is for the construction of
Gowanus Parkwey, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt
Parkway. Buildings on the west side of the avenue were left
unmolested.
View 2 shows the 8ullivan Dry Dock and Repair yard,
formerly the Todd Shipyard, at the S.W. corner of 24th Street.
View 3 shows the S.W. corner of 25th Street.
October, 1940
Views 1.2,3
P. L. Sperr
